WLAN Protected Setup
Press the WLAN Protected Setup button on your router. It may be called \"WPS\" or contain this symbol:
Enter pin %1$s on your WLAN router. The setup can take up to two minutes to complete.

"To improve location accuracy and for other purposes, %1$s wants to turn on network scanning, even when WLAN is off.
Allow this for all apps that want to scan?"

Phone setup may require significant network activity."

WLAN calling mode

When WLAN calling is on, your phone can route calls via WLAN networks or your carrier’s network, depending on your preference and which signal is stronger. Before turning on this feature, check with your carrier regarding fees and other details.
WLAN MAC address

Updating WLAN setting
WLAN
Back up app data, WLAN passwords, and other settings to Google servers
Stop backing up your WLAN passwords, bookmarks, other settings, and app data, plus erase all copies on Google servers?
Stop backing up device data (such as WLAN passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps), and erase all copies on Google Drive?

"Automatically back up device data (such as WLAN passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) remotely.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is periodically saved remotely. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages, and photos."
WLAN setup
Connect to WLAN network %s
Connecting to WLAN network %s…
"You can't configure an EAP WLAN connection during setup. After setup, you can do that in Settings > Wireless & networks."

Touch Next" to continue with setup.
Touch "Back to connect to a different WLAN network.
Show WLAN usage
Hide WLAN
Set WLAN data limit
WLAN
Disable background data on mobile data network only. WLAN will be used if available.

"This feature may cause an app that depends on background data to stop working when WLAN isn't available.
Check settings within the app to see if there are more appropriate data usage controls available."
"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to a WLAN network."

"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to a WLAN network.
This setting affects all users on this phone."

Select the WLAN networks that are mobile hotspots. Apps can be restricted from using these networks when running in the background. Apps may also generate warnings when using these networks for large downloads.
WLAN networks
To select mobile hotspots, turn WLAN on.

"You can share this device with other people by creating additional users. Each user has their own space, which they can customize with their own apps, wallpaper, and so on. Users can also adjust tablet settings like WLAN that affect everyone.
After you create a new user, that person needs to go through a setup process.
Any user can accept updated app permissions on behalf of all other users."
WLAN and mobile data
Allow modification of WLAN and mobile network settings
WLAN network connection
WLAN WLAN call calling
Set up WLAN NFC tag
Portable WLAN hotspot %1$s is active. WLAN for this device has been turned off.
"WLAN, Bluetooth, and mobile data network are turned off. You can't make phone calls or connect to the Internet."
Internet is available only via WLAN
Background data is only available via WLAN. This may affect some apps or services when WLAN is not available.
WLAN
WLAN bridge
WLAN bridge settings
Configure WLAN bridge
Set the bridge name, password, and more
Help

"1. WLAN bridge can significantly improve the transmission range and intensity of WLAN signals. Other devices can be connected to your current WLAN network through your device. 2. WLAN bridge supports access from up to 4 devices. 3. WLAN bridge does not work with the WLAN hotspot and WLAN Direct features. If WLAN bridge is enabled, some applications that use P2P services may not work properly. 4. Using WLAN bridge consumes your battery power faster."
WLAN connection required
Share connected WLAN network
Connected to WLAN network %s

Huawei Beam lets you transfer files, such as pictures, videos, contacts and URLs, between your device and another NFC-capable device. Huawei Beam is activated by placing the two devices close together (usually back to back) and tapping your screen. Please note that your Bluetooth or WLAN may be turned on automatically before file transmission.
Display your phone screen on another display over a WLAN connection
WLAN networks %s available. Do you want to stop data service and connect to a WLAN network?
Found WLAN signal, would you like to use this WLAN network?
WLAN networks %s available. Do you want to connect to a WLAN network?
Current connection signal is weak, would you like to use another WLAN network?
Advanced settings

"Huawei Beam lets you transfer files to other NFC devices by placing the devices close together. For example, you can wirelessly transfer pictures, videos, contacts, URLs, and more between two NFC-capable devices. Simply: 1. Place the front panel of your device against another NFC device, and pick up your device after you hear a tone. 2. Touch your screen within three seconds of hearing the tone. 3. Place the front panel of your device against the other NFC device again to complete the transfer. Please note that your Bluetooth or WLAN may be turned on automatically before file transmission."

"1. You can use a portable WLAN hotspot device as your Internet access point. Peripherals can be connected to your device through the WLAN and connected devices will access the Internet through the mobile network. 2. Using a portable WLAN hotspot will require your mobile data connection to be on, and will consume some data traffic. 3. Using a portable WLAN hotspot may drain your battery life faster."
"Manual connection: 1. Turn on WLAN on the target device, and find the hotspot %1$s. 2. Connect to the hotspot."
China Mobile WLAN
You are connected to a China Mobile WLAN network. Using this network may produce applicable WLAN usage fees.
Do not remind again
China Mobile WLAN reminder
"Remind me when I'm connected to a China Mobile WLAN network"
Do not display any notifications when switching networks (mobile data to WLAN and vice versa, or between WLAN networks)
Use GPS and WLAN to estimate location
Use WLAN to estimate location
WLAN+
Intelligently select WLAN or mobile data network

"When WLAN+ is enabled, your WLAN connectivity will be evaluated to provide smart network switching (WLAN data usage may increase). WLAN+ automatically: 1. Switches between WLAN and mobile data (with notifications) to provide a smooth Internet experience. 2. Turns on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it."
WLAN+ settings
Intelligently switch between WLAN and mobile data networks for a better Internet experience.
Automatically turn on WLAN when you approach a known location.

"When WLAN+ is enabled, your WLAN connectivity will be evaluated to provide smart network switching (WLAN data usage may increase). WLAN+ automatically: 1. Switches between WLAN and mobile data to provide a smooth Internet experience. 2. Turns on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it."
Use GPS, WLAN, and mobile networks
Use WLAN and mobile networks
GPS acceleration
Allow GPS to collect nearby cellular base station and WLAN data to provide quicker and more accurate location services
Unable to find WLAN hotspot
Unable to connect to WLAN
Unable to access Internet over WLAN
WLAN Direct connection failed
Unable to find WLAN Direct device

"No available devices found, it may be that: 1. The paired device is not discoverable. 2. The paired device is experiencing technical issues. Try restarting WLAN and re-open WLAN Direct. 3. Your own device is experiencing technical issues. Try restarting WLAN and re-open WLAN Direct."

"The connection could not be established. Possible reasons: 1. The paired device didn't accept the connection request. 2. Either device has already established another WLAN Direct connection. 3. The paired device is experiencing technical issues. Try restarting it."
Scan the QR code to connect to this WLAN network
"If the device can't be found, try the following:"

"1. Make sure the device is scanning for other devices. 2. If the peer device is experiencing issues, restart WLAN and access WLAN Direct again. 3. If your device is experiencing issues, restart WLAN and access WLAN Direct again."
"1. Make sure that the peer device has accepted the connection request. 2. Make sure both devices have not connected to other devices. 3. If the peer device is experiencing issues, try reconnecting."

"When WLAN+ is enabled, your WLAN connectivity will be evaluated to provide smart network switching (WLAN data usage may increase). WLAN+ automatically: 1. Switches between WLAN and mobile data (You can select the default switching mode in the mobile network settings) to provide a smooth Internet experience. 2. Turns on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it."
When Link+ live update is enabled, your phone automatically updates the data of communication parameters through your wireless network (WLAN by default) in order to improve relevant Link+ features.

"When WLAN+ is enabled, your WLAN connectivity will be evaluated to provide smart network switching (WLAN data usage may increase). WLAN+ automatically: 1. Switches between WLAN and mobile data (You can select the default switching mode in the mobile network settings) to provide a smooth Internet experience. 2. Turns on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it. 3. Evaluates available WLAN networks. Device will not auto-connect to saved networks without an Internet connection. 4. For some free WLAN hotspots, obtains the verification code from the incoming SMS message and logs into the network via the browser (currently only supported in China)."

"When WLAN+ is enabled, your WLAN connectivity will be evaluated to provide smart network switching (WLAN data usage may increase). WLAN+ automatically: 1. Switches between WLAN and mobile data to provide a smooth Internet experience. 2. Turns on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it. 3. Evaluates available WLAN networks. Device will not auto-connect to saved networks without an Internet connection."

"1. Your printer and phone aren't connected to the same WLAN network. 2. Your printer doesn't support this particular printing service (confirm with manufacturer). 3. Searching has timed out. Try again if this is the case. 4. Your printer has crashed. Restart your printer and try again."
WLAN security check
Check the security level of connected WLAN networks through Phone Manager, and pause auto-connect to saved networks that pose security risks

"When WLAN+ is enabled, your WLAN connectivity will be evaluated to provide smart network switching, and it will automatically update the optimization parameters through WLAN (WLAN data usage may increase). WLAN+ automatically: 1. Switches between WLAN and mobile data (You can select the default switching mode in the mobile network settings) to provide a smooth Internet experience. 2. Turns on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it. 3. Evaluates available WLAN networks. For saved networks that have no Internet access, auto-connect is paused. 4. For certain free WLAN hotspots, detects and accesses the verification code from the incoming SMS verification message and logs into the network via the browser automatically (currently only supported in China)."

"You can share this device with other people by creating additional users. Each user has their own space, which they can customize with apps, wallpaper, and more. Users can also adjust device settings like WLAN that affect everyone.
When you add a new user, that person needs to set up their space.
Any user can update apps for all other users."
Your device will search for nearby printers over a WLAN connection when you enable the printing service, which will produce WLAN traffic.
WLAN calling
Enable WLAN calling
If enabled, you will not be able to place emergency calls through WLAN. Enable?
When you use Bluetooth, WLAN Direct and tethering & portable hotspot, other devices will see this name.
Modifying the device name will disconnect the current WLAN hotspot connection. Modify it?
Write to WLAN NFC tag
Smart switching between WLAN and mobile data
Evaluate WLAN connectivity and switch between WLAN (may increase traffic) and mobile data to choose the best network connection. Default switch mode is set in mobile network settings
Evaluate WLAN connectivity and switch between WLAN (may increase traffic) and mobile data to choose the best network connection
Turn on/off WLAN automatically
Turn on WLAN when in range of a known WLAN network and connects to it
Evaluate available WLAN networks
Evaluate available WLAN networks. Auto-connect is paused for saved networks that have no Internet access
Optimize login experience for free WLAN hotspots

For certain free WLAN hotspots, detect and access the verification code from the incoming SMS verification message and logs in to the network via the browser automatically (currently only supported in Mainland China)
When Link+ live update is enabled, your phone automatically updates communication parameters data through your wireless network (WLAN by default) in order to improve relevant communication features.

WLAN" "
Mobile data" "
Bluetooth

WLAN" "
Bluetooth
Use GPS and WLAN
Use WLAN

"1. WLAN bridge significantly improves the transmission range and intensity of WLAN signals. Other devices can connect to your current WLAN network through your device. 2. WLAN bridge supports access from up to 4 devices. 3. WLAN bridge does not work with the WLAN hotspot and WLAN Direct features. If WLAN bridge is enabled, some apps that use P2P services may not work properly. 4. Using WLAN bridge consumes battery power more quickly. 5. If you receive a message notifying you that WLAN resources are being used by another service, go to Settings > WLAN > WLAN Direct and disconnect any connected devices. Or you can turn WLAN off and then on again to auto-disconnect all devices."
Scan to connect to this WLAN network

"1. Make sure Access my location is enabled. 2. Select Use GPS, WLAN, and mobile networks in Location mode. 3. Connect to a WLAN hotspot or enable mobile data. 4. Check if the app you are using has access to the Location permission in Phone manager > Permission manager > Access location info. 5. If you have set Location mode as Use GPS only, please make sure you are using location access in an open and unobstructed environment where GPS signals can be received normally. 6. If you are connected to a public hotspot, try turning off WLAN and enabling mobile data. Then try location access again."

"1. Select Use GPS, WLAN, and mobile networks in Location mode for more accurate location access. 2. If you are using a metal case on your device, remove the case or use a non-metallic case and try again. 3. Check if the app you are using has access to the Location permission in Phone manager > Permission manager > Access location info. 4. Navigation works better in wide, unobstructed areas. Place your phone in a position near the windshield of your vehicle, such as the dashboard or other unobstructed areas in your car."

"%1$d. WLAN bridge significantly improves the transmission range and intensity of WLAN signals. Other devices can connect to your current WLAN network through your device. %2$d. WLAN bridge supports access from up to %6$d devices. %3$d. WLAN bridge does not work with the WLAN hotspot and WLAN Direct features. If WLAN bridge is enabled, some apps that use P2P services may not work properly. %4$d. Using WLAN bridge consumes battery power more quickly. %5$d. If you receive a message notifying you that WLAN resources are being used by another service, go to Settings > WLAN > WLAN Direct and disconnect any connected devices. Or you can turn WLAN off and then on again to auto-disconnect all devices."

"%1$d. You can use a portable WLAN hotspot device as your Internet access point. Peripherals can be connected to your device through WLAN and connected devices will access the Internet through the mobile network. %2$d. Using a portable WLAN hotspot will require your mobile data connection to be enabled, and will consume some data. %3$d. Using a portable WLAN hotspot may drain your battery faster."
"Manual connection: %2$d. Enable WLAN on target device, and find the hotspot %1$s. %3$d. Connect to hotspot."

"%1$d. Make sure Access my location is enabled. %2$d. Select Use GPS, WLAN, and mobile networks in Location mode. %3$d. Connect to a WLAN hotspot or enable mobile data. %4$d. Check if the app you are using has access to the Location permission in Phone manager > Permission manager > Access location info. %5$d. If you have set Location mode as Use GPS only, please make sure you are using location access in an open and unobstructed environment where GPS signals can be received normally. %6$d. If you are connected to a public hotspot, try turning off WLAN and enabling mobile data. Then try location access again."

"%1$d. Select Use GPS, WLAN, and mobile networks in Location mode for more accurate location access. %2$d. If you are using a metal case on your device, remove the case or use a non-metallic case and try again. %3$d. Check if the app you are using has access to the Location permission in Phone manager > Permission manager > Access location info. %4$d. Navigation works better in wide, unobstructed areas. Place your phone in a position near the windshield of your vehicle, such as the dashboard or other unobstructed areas in your car."
Using a portable hotspot requires disabling Data saver. Disable?
WLAN hotspot lets you share your network connection with others, but may drain battery power faster and increase data usage fees.
WLAN hotspot disabled
WLAN hotspot disabled
WLAN is connected, forbid to open this function, please close the WLAN.
WLAN turned on
"Mobile hotspot and WLAN can't be turned on at the same time. Turn off WLAN?"
"WLAN must be turned off now. It will be automatically turned on again once your phone has communicated with AT&T's servers."

If you turn off Broadcast network name (SSID) option, your phone will not be visible to other devices and will not appear in the list of available WLAN networks. Other devices can still connect to your hotspot by entering your network name manually.
Auto-connection to AT&T WLAN enabled
Auto-connection to AT&T WLAN disabled
Restart WLAN for the Auto-connection settings to take effect.
Check for Internet accessibility when connecting to a WLAN hotspot
WLAN has been disabled by the device administrator
To complete the setup, your tablet needs access to a WLAN network. Once setup is complete, you can switch between mobile data and WLAN.
WLAN frequency band
%1$s manages your device and doesn’t allow you to modify or delete this WLAN network. For more information, contact your administrator.
